content.user_title: Build Supabase backends with Edge Functions
content.value_statement: Writing backend code for Supabase can be complex with many moving parts. This skill provides ready-to-use patterns for Edge Functions, database design, Row-Level Security, and integrations so you can ship faster with fewer bugs.
actual_capabilities: Provides Supabase Edge Function patterns with Deno runtime
Shows PostgreSQL schema design with Row-Level Security policies
Demonstrates JWT authentication and authorization patterns
Covers Zod validation for type-safe input handling
Includes Resend email and Stripe payment integration examples
Offers controller, service, and repository layer patterns
limitations: Does not provide executable code or scripts to run
Requires Supabase account and CLI for local development
Skill is a guide, not a replacement for understanding underlying technologies
Examples are scaffold templates that need customization for production use

use_cases.title: Build serverless APIs
use_cases.description: Create Supabase Edge Functions for your web or mobile application with proper auth and validation.

use_cases.title: Design secure databases
use_cases.description: Design PostgreSQL schemas with Row-Level Security to enforce data access policies at the database level.

use_cases.title: Integrate payments and email
use_cases.description: Add Stripe subscription handling and Resend transactional emails to your application.

prompt_templates.title: New Edge Function
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Supabase Edge Function called create-user that validates input with Zod, verifies the JWT token, and inserts a record into the users table with RLS policies.

prompt_templates.title: Database Schema
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a PostgreSQL schema for a posts table with user ownership, published status, and proper indexes. Include RLS policies for read and write access.

prompt_templates.title: Auth Middleware
prompt_templates.prompt: Add JWT verification to an existing Edge Function and implement role-based access control using custom claims in the user metadata.

prompt_templates.title: Stripe Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Stripe webhook handler Edge Function that verifies the signature, handles checkout.session.completed events, and updates user subscription status in the database.

output_examples.input: Create an Edge Function for creating blog posts
output: Deno.serve handler with CORS preflight handling
Zod schema for title, content, and optional tags
Database insert with user_id from authenticated user
RLS policy ensures users can only insert their own posts
Proper error handling with status codes (400, 401, 500)
Success response with 201 status and created post data

output_examples.input: Set up Row-Level Security for a table
output: ALTER TABLE table ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY
CREATE POLICY for SELECT using auth.uid() = user_id
CREATE POLICY for INSERT with CHECK auth.uid() = user_id
CREATE INDEX on columns used in RLS policies
Test policies with different user roles
Zod schema with email, password, username fields
Password minimum length and complexity checks
Return clear error messages for each validation failure

best_practices: Always verify JWT tokens at the start of every Edge Function to prevent unauthorized access
Enable Row-Level Security on ALL tables containing user data for database-level protection
Validate all input with Zod schemas before any database operations or business logic
Use environment variables for all secrets and API keys - never hardcode credentials in code
anti_patterns: Skipping JWT verification in production Edge Functions exposes your API to unauthorized access
Disabling RLS to simplify development defeats the purpose of Supabase security features
Using console.error for error handling instead of proper HTTP responses breaks client integration
Bypassing the Supabase client to query the database directly circumvents RLS protections

faq.question: What Supabase features does this skill cover?
faq.answer: Edge Functions, PostgreSQL database, Row-Level Security, Auth, Storage, and Realtime subscriptions.

faq.question: Can I use these patterns with regular Express servers?
faq.answer: Yes. Many patterns (validation, services, repositories) work with any Node.js backend framework.

faq.question: Does this skill require Supabase CLI?
faq.answer: Supabase CLI is recommended for local development and testing Edge Functions before deployment.

faq.question: Is my data safe with the examples shown?
faq.answer: The examples emphasize security best practices including RLS, JWT verification, and environment variable secrets.

faq.question: Why use Edge Functions instead of a traditional server?
faq.answer: Edge Functions scale automatically, run globally at edge locations, and integrate tightly with Supabase services.

faq.question: How does this compare to using the Supabase JavaScript client?
faq.answer: Edge Functions run server-side for operations that require elevated permissions or secret API keys.
